snippet: Some of the 53 schoolgirls who escaped Boko Haram kidnappers told of their terror, and President Goodluck Jonathan rejected the militant group’s demand for a prisoner exchange.
abstract: Nigerian Pres Goodluck Jonathan rejects Boko Haram’s demand that he free the group's imprisoned members around the country in exchange for the remaining abducted schoolgirls; government has been at war with the radical Islamist group Boko Haram for years, but accounts of the girls who escaped show how easily the group was able to overrun a state institution in a region already under emergency rule, and add to worries about others still held captive.
lead_paragraph: Some of the 53 schoolgirls who escaped Boko Haram kidnappers told of their terror, and President Goodluck Jonathan rejected the militant group’s demand for a prisoner exchange.

headline.main: Tales of Escapees in Nigeria Add to Worries About Other Kidnapped Girls
headline.print_headline: Tales of Escaped Girls Add to Worries in Nigeria
